attributes.action: We call on Government to keep the wearing of masks in public places mandatory
attributes.additional_details:
Our adult vaccine rollout only completes in September. There is no rollout planned for children at all.
By 19 July we will have a million cases of covid. Hospitalisations of children are rising. 1000s of cases of long covid will devastate young lives & educations.
Covid is an airborne disease. Masks reduce its transmission. This is an issue of public health, not a question of individual liberty. For most it is no issue to wear a mask.  Government is irresponsible to halt mandatory mask wearing.
attributes.background:
Mandatory wearing of masks ends on July 19.
This is a mistake. Government must protect the vulnerable, essential workers & children for whom there is still no vaccine programme.
Masks must remain mandatory in public places including public transport at least until our vaccine is fully rolled out.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Keep face covering mandatory in indoor public settings beyond 19th July 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590616

Keep mandatory face coverings in supermarkets and on public transport: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590836
 
Keep face masks mandatory for public transport after the lifting of restrictions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590694

Keep requirement to wear a face covering in shops & supermarkets after July 19th: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590829
